SEARCH
Package model

Class TableTop

java.lang.Object
model.TableTop
public class TableTop extends Object
Class that holds information about the tabletop. It contains the grid of cards and the deck of cards. You can construct it from the number of players, for a new game, or from a saved object representing the tabletop.

  • Constructor Details

    • TableTop

      public TableTop(int nPlayers)
      Creates a new TableTop object with a specified number of players. The size of the table is set to SIZE x SIZE, and it is filled with cards according to the rules of the game.
      Parameters:
      nPlayers - The number of players in the game.

    • TableTop

      public TableTop(SaveTableTop tableTop, int nPlayers)
      Creates a new TableTop object from a saved tabletop.
      Parameters:
      tableTop - the `SaveTableTop` object to load from.
      nPlayers - the number of players in the game.

  • Method Details

    • isUsed

      public boolean isUsed(int y, int x)
      Returns true if the position is used in this tabletop, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      y - The y coordinate of the position.
      x - The x coordinate of the position.
      Returns:
      The card at the specified position.

    • fillTable

      public void fillTable()
      Fills any empty spaces on the table with cards drawn from the deck, as long as the card meets the requirements for the position.

    • needRefill

      public boolean needRefill()
      Determines if the table needs to be refilled based on whether there are any empty spaces next to non-empty spaces. Returns true if a refill is needed, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      True if the table needs to be refilled, false otherwise.

    • isPickable

      public boolean isPickable(int y, int x) throws InvalidMoveException
      Determines if a specified position on the table is pickable based on whether it is adjacent to an empty space and has not already been picked.
      Parameters:
      y - The vertical index of the specified position.
      x - The horizontal index of the specified position.
      Returns:
      True if the specified position is pickable, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - If the specified position is not valid or is already empty.

    • pickCard

      public Card pickCard(int y, int x) throws InvalidMoveException
      Picks a card from the table and returns it.
      Parameters:
      y - The vertical index of the specified position.
      x - The horizontal index of the specified position.
      Returns:
      The card at the specified position.
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - If the specified position is already empty or not valid.

    • getDeck

      public CardsDeck getDeck()
      Getter for the `deck` field.
      Returns:
      the `deck` field.

    • getCard

      public Optional<Card> getCard(int y, int x) throws InvalidMoveException
      Return the card at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      y - the y coordinate.
      x - the x coordinate.
      Returns:
      the card at the given coordinates (might be empty).
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - if the coordinates are outside the tabletop.

    • getSerializable

      public Card[][] getSerializable()
      Returns a serializable copy of the table Note: this method must only be used to send the table over network, DON'T use it in any other case and once received, convert it immediately to it's `Optional` form
      Returns:
      a serializable copy of the table

    • getSaveTableTop

      public SaveTableTop getSaveTableTop()
      Return a serializable copy of the tabletop
      Returns:
      a serializable copy of the tabletop
